CatDescriptText: Mr. Richard Saunders, confectionary owner, Homewood and Mrs. Ruth Tench, hospital service worker, North Side, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 5, 1962, pg. 6 with question: "Do you think Southerners are sincere in wanting to send Negroes without jobs to the North on Freedom Trains?" Mr. Richard Saunders' answer reads: "I actually believe that a small percentage are sincere but the general feeling in the South towards Negroes is not that of sincerity."  Mrs. Ruth Tench's answer reads: "I don't think too many of them are sincere..."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Richard Saunders wearing moustache and light colored long sleeved shirt with opened collar, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Ruth Tench wearing light colored vest, patterned blouse, and light colored gloves, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
